author: nicoarqueros
title: Cotalker integration
description: Adoption with businesses and enterprise solutions with Cardano is difficult and there is no a good platform to get traction and adoption.

f6_assessments.q0: We realize that the purpose of the proposal is to make an integration between an asset and operations management platform and Cardano, to facilitate the storage of information. This main objective of the project even fits the premises of the challenge in which it finds itself, since it can increase Cardano's scope by facilitating operations involving businesses. However, as described in the proposal we do not have more in-depth information that convinces why this implementation will cost the large budget of $100,000. For amounts in this range, we expect a greater level of detail about the possible positive impacts when implementing the idea, more detailed motivations that justify the use of Cardano technologies and in this case it would even be possible to demonstrate an example that shows a more beneficial tangible form of the planned integration.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the action plan, we also noticed that there is a little more clarity about the activities that will be carried out. We note that in the initial months of the project, a planning will be carried out. But as described, some doubts arise, for example: Which professionals will be involved in this planning stage? What are the main points that will be focused to carry out this initial integration? Will any tool be used to build these stages, such as Miro? What functionality will be verified during the planned test? It would be important if some of these questions were better answered in order to have a better clarity on the execution of the project. And regarding the budget details, we also noticed that it was not indicated how the amount of $100,000 will be distributed among the listed actions. The backend development stage to be able to write for Cardano would be one of the central points of the project, but we don't know how much will be allocated for this. Taking this action as an example, it would be important for us to know this value, as well as the characteristics of the responsible developers, which languages ​​are intended to be used, how many hours of work per week are planned or what the value of the work hour is. It seems interesting that some of these points mentioned were implemented to better understand the progress as a whole.
f6_assessments.q2:
The stated ways to follow the project's evolution are also not very well detailed. As one of these ways, the very success of the integration was indicated. But this indication by itself only refers to the final result and does not provide further information throughout the process. For this, it would be interesting to define, for example, sprints with a constant duration (like weekly) and the publication of the results being achieved in something like a public board where the community could better observe the goals being achieved. Perhaps the lack of this information would be alleviated by more detailed ideas about the perception of success, but we noticed that in this topic the same things were indicated as before.

Thus, it seems cool that the proposal seeks to answer some of the questions raised so that the general idea around the project is more complete.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal is for the integration of the Cotalker backend records on the Cardano blockchain. This is a B2B and will drive all the proper objectives for this challenge. The proposer states that this solution will be implemented for all current customers of Cotalker (I could not find who is that.)
Therefore I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposal is very strangely short and lacks all kinds of details. It looks like it was made in 10 minutes and that was it, but it was posted on 03.03.2022 , so there was plenty of time to ad detail and expand.
The proposer does not provide any meaningful action plan or road map. 
The budget is not broken down, at all, it is not even mentioned anywhere else but the “requested funds” section. One could think that this is a typo, and $100 000 is actually $10 000 because there I no mention of that number anywhere else in the proposal.
The proposer describes the team the following way: “dcSpark and Cotalker”.  That is not enough. Voters don’t know, they don’t have to know. It is the proposer’s job to make a good and informative proposal.
The proposer didn’t outline any risks. 
I strongly disagree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully, not because I don’t believe in the companies, but because this proposal is out of line and does not provide enough information for the voter to decide if he wants to support it.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability section is of two components “success integration and pilot with at least two well known companies” the same thing repeats for success. The question is how an auditor to decide if and when and how much funds to send to the proposer’s wallet and how to check the progress of the project?
The answer is there is no way. Therefore I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.
Dear proposers, I really think that your idea is great and I want to support it, but the proposal you have made does not allow me to do so. Please next time, spend a little more time and explain your proposal in detail for the voter to understand and support. Thank you.

f6_assessments.q0: Instead of having a big goal to pursue and a high mountain to climb, the concept for this proposal is a pretty simple but decent and totally reachable one. The team clearly knows where their limits are and how they should use their ability to contribute to the community. However, what is shown in this part of the proposal is only the bare basics, the information given is very lacking, both in terms of the amount of information given and in view of how the team members are trying to express themselves via the writing of the proposal. They should give out much more detail in each of the parts: what the situation that leads to their decision to initiate the project, what their project is about, how their project will relate to the future of the community in general and the challenge in particular, what obstacles they are facing and how they are going to tackle it. Otherwise, the proposal cannot persuade.
f6_assessments.q1: Similar to the previous part, the team members have only given out the very outline of every category of the part. The team ought to improve the detailing of the information here as well. For the roadmap, they should specify what milestones they have achieved and what steps they are planning to take to proceed on the project, as detailed as possible. For the budget breakdown, they should let the numbers out and have people know how much of the total budget they will spend on which aspect of the project execution. And for the information on the individuals or groups behind the project, they ought to have a small biography of the key members or team, or at least their resolve and enthusiasm towards the goal they are setting on; anything more than just a name or two. That being said, the team in chief of the project does have a basic grasp of where they are going.
f6_assessments.q2: The answers for the questions in the part are way too short; and they are completely the same. The team ought to give out details about what methods and/or platforms they are using and to track down the progress of the project and specify more of their current answers. Overall, this is not a good proposal, and the team needs to add much more to their answers to improve upon the writing.

f6_assessments.q0:
A problem and a solution to the problem has been identified but they are presented in a vague manner ("to use Cardano as a source of true for storing operational information that can be verified" - it is difficult to understand the meaning of this statement.
The proposal doesn't align well with the Challenge brief. It should provide relevant info about the long-term vision, strategy and roadmap as well as short-term deliverables attainable in the next 6-9 months. It is unclear what is the real world use case for this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
There aren't any relevant info about the team members experience in their area of expertize. The proposer should provide traits (links to social media, past successfully implemented projects etc.) to support their skills.

The budget is not broken down into identifiable items so, it's very unclear what is to be spent for and what is the outcome of those activities.

The proposal does not provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how. (first two phases are: "one month for planning" and "three month for planning" - are meaningful for any outsider, they need to be rephrased to something more consistent i.e.: team assembling - 1 week, whitepaper draw - 2 weeks etc.)

The proposer has not considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation. ("Low risk implementation." - this statement is based on what?)
f6_assessments.q2: No KPI/metrics are defined the measure the success of the implementation. The proposal lacks in providing relevant info about what is to be done and how and most important what is the problem that needs a feasible solution to solve it. Being poorly written it can't be assessed at this time.

solution: Cotalker integration will allow companies to use Cardano as a source of true for storing operational information that can be verified.
experience: Together dcSpark and Cotalker have experience with blockchain and working with B2B companies.
